subject: Re: [junit] Re: Create a dynamic suite of tests
msgSnippet: What do you gain by re-running Test 1 each time there is a failure? ... ok sorry , what i mean was Run Test 1 if error System.exit(2) Run Test 2 if error run
messageBody:
What do you gain by re-running Test 1 each time there is a failure?

-------------- Original message --------------


ok sorry , what i mean was

Run Test 1 if error System.exit(2)
Run Test 2 if error run Test1 then run Test 3
Run Test 3 if error run Test1 then run Test 4
...
generate report


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Simon Chappell
<simonpeterchappell@g...> wrote:
> Isn't there a huge danger of an endless loop here?
>
>
> On Thu, 24 Mar 2005 18:43:08 -0000, choc_mah <choc_mah@h...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > Ok , i hope someone can help me out
> >
> > it's possible to create a dynamic suite of tests using JUnit
> >
> > ex:
> > start test
> > Test 1
> > If faillure or error found - run Test 1
> > Test 2
> > If faillure or error found - run Test 1
> > Test 3
> > ...
> > generate a rapport
> >
> > i tried to use a testlistener, but i really dont know if its the
> > right thing to use, any exemple??
> >
> > thanks
> >
